entry.title: The Rural Development (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the purposes of implementation of:

entry.title: The Rural Payments (Appeals) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the review of certain decisions of the Scottish Ministers in relation to payment of certain agricultural subsidies and other rural payments. After review, a right of appeal of such decisions is provided for to the Scottish Land Court.

entry.title: The Scottish Marine Regions Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order which is made under section 5(5) of the Marine (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the 2010 Act”) makes provision in connection with Scottish marine regions. They are areas for which Scottish Ministers may prepare and adopt a regional marine plan. That is a plan which, amongst other things, states Scottish Ministers’ policies for the sustainable development of the area. It is possible for Ministers to delegate functions in relation to regional marine planning, including the preparation and adoption of regional marine plans.

entry.title: The Londonderry Harbour (Variation of Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends section 57 of the Londonderry Port and Harbour Act 1854 to provide for the limits of jurisdiction of the Londonderry Port and Harbour Commissioners with respect to conservancy and rates as extending from Craigavon Bridge to a line drawn from Greencastle Fort in the County of Donegal to the Tower on Magilligan Point in the City and County of Londonderry.

entry.title: The Forth Road Bridge Act 2013 (Commencement) Order 2015
entry.summary: Sections 6 to 8 of the Forth Road Bridge Act 2013 came into force on 29th June 2013 (the day after that Act received Royal Assent). This Order appoints 1st June 2015 as the day on which the remaining provisions of that Act will come into force.

entry.title: The Student Fees (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Student Fees (Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”) by increasing the basic and higher amounts prescribed in the 2005 Regulations. The amendments come into operation on 1st September 2016.

entry.title: The Carbon Accounting Scheme (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Carbon Accounting Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2010 (“the 2010 Regulations”), which make provision about carbon units and carbon accounting in the years 2010 to 2012 for the purposes of Part 1 of the Climate Change (Scotland) Act 2009 (the “2009 Act”).

title.div: The National Curriculum (Moderation of Assessment Arrangements for the Second and Third Key Stages) (Wales) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn y Cwricwlwm Cenedlaethol (Cymedroli Trefniadau Asesu ar gyfer yr Ail Gyfnod Allweddol a’r Trydydd Cyfnod Allweddol) (Cymru) 2015

div.p: Section 108(3)(c) of the Education Act 2002 (“the 2002 Act”) provides a power for the Welsh Ministers to prescribe by way of an order assessment arrangements for the key stages. In addition section 108(7) of the 2002 Act allows the Welsh Ministers to impose functions on a school governing body, head teacher and local authority in relation to any such order made under section 108(3)(c) of the 2002 Act.

Mae adran 108(3)(c) o Ddeddf Addysg 2002 (“Deddf 2002”) yn darparu pŵer i Weinidogion Cymru i ragnodi drwy orchymyn drefniadau asesu ar gyfer y cyfnodau allweddol. Yn ychwanegol mae adran 108(7) o Ddeddf 2002 yn caniatáu i Weinidogion Cymru osod swyddogaethau ar gorff llywodraethu ysgol, ar bennaeth ac ar awdurdod lleol mewn perthynas ag unrhyw orchymyn o’r fath a wneir o dan adran 108(3)(c) o Ddeddf 2002.

title.div: The Care and Support (Assessment) (Wales) Regulations 2015 / Rheoliadau Gofal a Chymorth (Asesu) (Cymru) 2015

div.p: Sections 19, 21 and 24 of the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 impose duties on a local authority to assess an adult’s needs for care and support, a child’s needs for care and support and a carer’s needs for support. These Regulations make further provision about such assessments.

Mae adrannau 19, 21 a 24 o Ddeddf Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol a Llesiant (Cymru) 2014 yn gosod dyletswyddau ar awdurdod lleol i asesu anghenion oedolyn am ofal a chymorth, anghenion plentyn am ofal a chymorth ac anghenion gofalwr am gymorth. Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud darpariaeth bellach ynghylch asesiadau o’r fath.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Waste (Meaning of Hazardous Waste and European Waste Catalogue) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend various enactments to effect changes as a consequence of (1) the amendment of Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste (“the Directive”) (OJ L 312. 22.11.2008, p.89) by Commission Regulation 1357/2014/EU (“the Regulation”) (OJ L 365, 19.12.2004, p.89) and (2) the amendment of Commission Decision 2000/532/EC establishing a list of wastes (“the 2000 Decision”) (OJ L 226, 6.9.2000, p.3) by Commission Decision 2014/955/EU (“the 2014 Decision”) (OJ L 370, 30.12.2014).

entry.title: The Fisheries (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the list of waters which are now exempt from catch and release for salmon angling.

entry.title: The Hazardous Waste (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under Section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972. They amend a number of pieces of Northern Ireland legislation to bring into effect the changes introduced by Commission Decision 2014/955/EU amending Decision 2000/532/EC (the Decision) on the list of waste pursuant to Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council. Commission Decision 2000/532/EC is directly binding as regards determination of waste that is to be considered as hazardous waste. The changes being introduced by way of the updated Decision come into effect on 1 June 2015.

entry.title: The Crown Court (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Crown Court Rules (Northern Ireland) 1979 (S.R. 1979 No. 90) to take account of amendments made to the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (“the 2002 Act”) by the Serious Crime Act 2015 by—

entry.title: The Hornsea One Offshore Wind Farm (Correction) Order 2015
entry.summary: The Order corrects errors and omissions in The Hornsea One Offshore Wind Farm Order 2014 (“the Order”), a development consent order made under the Planning Act 2008, following a written request from the applicant for the development consent granted by the Order under paragraph 1(5)(a) of Schedule 4 to that Act.

entry.title: The Access to Justice (2003 Order) (Commencement No. 8) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 1st May 2015 certain provisions of the Access to Justice (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 regarding criminal defence services.

entry.title: The Scottish Tax Tribunals (Time Limits and Rules of Procedure) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the Scottish Tax Tribunal Rules which regulate the practice and procedure to be followed in proceedings before the First-tier Tax Tribunal for Scotland or the Upper Tax Tribunal for Scotland.

entry.title: The Bovine Viral Diarrhoea (Scotland) Amendment Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Bovine Viral Diarrhoea (Scotland) Order 2013 (“the 2013 Order”).

entry.title: The Less Favoured Area Support Scheme (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Less Favoured Area Support Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2010 (“the principal Regulations”). As amended by these Regulations, the principal Regulations make provision for the purposes of the implementation of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council on support for rural development by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and repealing Council Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (“the Rural Development Regulation” - OJ L 347, 20.12.2013 p.487), in particular Articles 31 and 32, and make provision for less favoured area support (”LFAS”) payments for the period 2015 to 2017 under the Scottish Rural Development Programme (SRDP) (see http://www.gov.scot/Topics/farmingrural/SRDP). By 2018, the LFAS Scheme will be replaced by a new scheme for payments in respect of areas facing natural or other specific constraints in accordance with the Rural Development Regulation.

entry.title: The Scottish Tax Tribunals (Conduct and Fitness Assessment Tribunal) Rules 2015
entry.summary: These Rules make provision in relation to complaints about the conduct of a member of the Scottish Tax Tribunals (Schedule 1) and in relation to proceedings before a fitness assessment tribunal constituted to ascertain whether such a member is unfit to continue in office (Schedule 2).
